text:
We're excited to announce enhancements to our Microsoft 365 enterprise plans. Starting April 2024, all E5 subscriptions will include advanced security features previously available as add-ons. While this represents a price adjustment of approximately 18%, the added value includes: 

â€¢ Microsoft Defender for Endpoint P2
â€¢ Azure AD Premium P2
â€¢ Microsoft Cloud App Security

Current E3 customers can lock in special upgrade pricing through March. Contact your Microsoft representative or partner to discuss transition options.

CrowdStrike Falcon platform adoption continues to accelerate with over 23,000 customers worldwide. To support continued innovation and maintain our industry-leading breach prevention, we're updating our pricing structure for new customers effective February 1, 2024.

Key updates:
â€¢ Simplified tier structure
â€¢ New volume discounts for 1000+ endpoints
â€¢ Enhanced support included in all tiers

Existing customers will maintain current pricing through their contract term. Learn more at our upcoming webinar.

Dell Technologies announces strategic partnership pricing for Q1 2024. Despite global supply chain challenges affecting component costs, we're offering exclusive discounts for our enterprise partners:

ðŸ”¹ PowerEdge servers: Up to 15% off with 3-year ProSupport
ðŸ”¹ PowerStore arrays: Special financing available
ðŸ”¹ VxRail hyperconverged: Bundle discounts with VMware

These limited-time offers help offset industry-wide price pressures. Connect with your Dell team today.

Important announcement for Palo Alto Networks customers: We're evolving our Prisma Cloud licensing to better align with customer consumption patterns. The new model introduces:

âœ… Flexible credit-based system
âœ… Unified licensing across all Prisma Cloud modules
âœ… Predictable pricing with annual commits

While list prices reflect a 12-15% adjustment, most customers will see cost optimization through the new consumption model. Transition support available through our Customer Success team.

Cisco announces updates to our enterprise agreement (EA) program. Starting FY24 Q3, we're introducing new benefits for qualifying customers:

â€¢ True Forward technology for software management
â€¢ Simplified renewal process
â€¢ Investment protection with price caps

Note: Hardware component costs have increased 20-30% industry-wide due to supply constraints. Our EA program helps mitigate these impacts for committed partners. Schedule a consultation with your Cisco account team.
